title: Video-Based Social Learning Design: Effective Content Creation and Utilization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and understanding of fundamental social studies concepts
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with optimized design of video learning materials as the core challenge

learning_goals: Learners will compare cognitive load between graphic/text types in video-based learning materials and select effective learning strategies.
Learners will analyze the impact of the presence/absence of the instructorâ€™s face (video) on learning performance and evaluate context-appropriate content design.
Learners will acquire factual knowledge at 80% or higher through video learning materials applying sequential/static presentation types.
Learners will achieve a subjective evaluation score of 3.5 or higher (on a 5-point scale) for video learning materials (ease of learning, concentration level, etc.).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
